description:
Adjustment:  The amount computed at the above rate shall be adjusted plus or minus by an amount calculated in accordance with the formula specified in the City's purchased power cost adjustment clause, which is incorporated by reference as a part of this rate schedule.

Minimum Charge:  The monthly minimum charge shall be the "customer charge" plus the "demand charge", if any.

The following Demand Charge schedule is applied:
  per kw of Billing Demand 		@ $11.71		per kw
  per kw of Excess Off-Peak Demand	@ $5.65		per kw


Determination of Billing Demand and Energy:
a.Measured Demands shall be the greatest 60-minute integrated kw demands during the entire current month.

b.Billing Demand shall be the amount equal to the greater of (I) the actual Measured Demand during Peak Demand Periods of the current billing month or (ii) eighty (80) per cent of the prior eleven (11) billing months.

c.Excess Off-Peak Demand shall be the amount, if any, by which the actual Measured Demand for the current billing month exceeds the Billing Demand for the current billing month.

d.Billing Energy shall be the total kwh of energy provided by the City during the current billing month.

For the purposes of this Rate Schedule, "Peak Demand Periods" shall include the period from 1:00 PM to 9:00 PM, Monday through Friday, during the months of June through September and 6:00 AM to 1:00 PM, Monday through Friday during the months of October through May.

Power Factor Correction:  When the average monthly power factor of the consumers power requirements is less than eighty-five (85) per cent, the billing demand in kilowatts will be corrected for that month by multiplying the billing demand by eighty-five (85) per cent and dividing same by the average power factor for that month, expressed in percentages.

name: Public School Rate (Schedule PS)
utility: City of Rock Hill, South Carolina (Utility Company)
